I suppose if you put enough rocket engines on a plane, it could fly to some of those places. I've even heard some murmurings over at the R&D Center about an engine that can switch between air-breathing and rocket modes!
Regardless, if we get more partnership requests, I advise a lukewarm "maybe" and the continued acquisition of free stuff.
Missions/Secondary/Kerbin_Rover/Descript: The LightYear Tire Company has been trying to convince us to test out their new tires. I’m not really into tires, but after 45 of my cease-and-desist letters bounced back, I've decided it’ll be easier to comply. Let’s slap some wheels on a vessel and launch it. Peer-pressured science is still science!
Missions/Secondary/Kerbin_Rover/Objectiv: Launch a vessel with a least 4 wheels.
Missions/Secondary/Kerbin_Rover/Debrief0:
Ah. The letters, phone calls, and signal flares have stopped. We're back to normal levels of chaos.
So peaceful.
You used those wheels so creatively! Unfortunately, it was all a plot to get a free tire commercial out of us. We caught LightYear's camera crew wearing camouflage in the bushes.

Still, LightYear’s new tire commercial is making our agency look really cool. I do wish they hadn't changed their slogan to, “LightYear, the only tires fit for space.” It's made our other manufacturers really mad. Our attempts to calm them down keep falling flat. Tire companies. Who knew there would be so much pressure?
Missions/Secondary/Kerbin_RoverSpeed01/D: Now that speed records are all the rage, our friends at Rovemate are feeling a little left out. Let's build a fast autonomous rover and shatter some land speed records. Remember to include a Rovemate probe core!
Missions/Secondary/Kerbin_RoverSpeed01/O: Reach a ground speed of over 150m/s on a rover with a Rovemate probe.
Missions/Secondary/Kerbin_RoverSpeed01/D: That was spectacular! We’ve been informed C7 Aerospace was (mildly) impressed.
Popcorn sales skyrocketed during the event. We earned enough for a self-heating breakroom snack machine!
Go enjoy the victory! Be ready to get back to work tomorrow morning!
Missions/Secondary/Kerbin_RoverSpeed02/D:
Rovemax has challenged us to double our last rover's land speed record - and then some. How much some, you ask?

They want us to create a rover that can top 340 m/s. We can use rockets, jet engines, SRBs, whatever.  As long as it stays on the ground, it counts.
Missions/Secondary/Kerbin_RoverSpeed02/O: While driving a rover, reach a ground speed over 340m/s.
Missions/Secondary/Kerbin_RoverSpeed02/D: Everyone in Mission Control cheered when your rover hit the mark. Kerbals were screaming, snacks were flying! Glorious!
Of course, it will take a week to clean up. We also shorted out a couple monitors.
What’s a little equipment loss compared to fame and glory? Go enjoy the celebration. It’s going to be ages before anyone tops this.
Missions/Secondary/Kerbin_Satellite/Desc: We’ve gotten some reports that one of our satellites looks lonely. I don't get it, but our probe engineers keep staring mournfully at the sky every time one of them passes overhead. Sometimes they cry. We'd better give the satellite a friend!
Missions/Secondary/Kerbin_Satellite/Obje: Orbit Kerbin with a probe core, antenna, and solar panel.
Missions/Secondary/Kerbin_Satellite/Debr: Excellent! Better internet connection, plus we've got footage of the satellite smiling!
I assume it's smiling. I can’t read satellite facial expressions. Maybe there’s a bit of bounce in their orbit?
We might have to make this a weekly thing. Friendships are so hard to come by.
Missions/Secondary/Kerbol_DestroyProbe/N: I, P.A.I.G.E: The Return of P.A.I.G.E.
Missions/Secondary/Kerbol_DestroyProbe/D:
Director! Director! Come quickly! Evil P.A.I.G.E has been posing as regular P.A.I.G.E. in the Training Center all along! The real P.A.I.G.E. was hidden in a folder Levi stumbled upon while trying to answer an email. Book guys are not very technical.

Our smartest scientists are fighting to keep Evil P.A.I.G.E. from corrupting our systems and taking over. We’re going to trap her in one more probe and make sure she doesn’t come back. Director, set a course for our sun, Kerbol. We'll fight fire with fire!
Missions/Secondary/Kerbol_DestroyProbe/O: Using a probe core, achieve an orbital altitude less than 600km from Kerbol.
Missions/Secondary/Kerbol_DestroyProbe/D: I can’t believe we were tricked! But it was really cool when the thermal damage fried her systems, and she couldn't transfer her consciousness to another satellite.
You thought of everything, Director!  I’m glad we can put this whole thing behind us. Fire is the best, isn't it?
Did you see the lights flicker just now? I must have imagined it.
Missions/Secondary/Kerbol_GrandTour/Desc:
Someone go start an extra strong pot of coffee. And call in the senior staff! 

The Kerbal Astronomical Society has challenged us to go sightseeing again - everywhere! Land on every planet and moon in the Kerbolar System, and come home safely. In one flight.

Jool has no landable surface, so you can skip that one. See? We made it easy!
Missions/Secondary/Kerbol_GrandTour/Obje: Land on all celestial bodies with landable surfaces and return to Kerbin.
Missions/Secondary/Kerbol_GrandTour/Debr: That was one of the most impressive missions in space sightseeing history! No one could top it.
At least not until we get to another star system.
Tomorrow, we'll celebrate with a commemorative plaque above the best coffee machine in Mission Control. No higher honor!
Missions/Secondary/Kerbol_OrbitLow/Descr:
Someone in the Snacks Department overheard our joke about sun-roasted popcorn and are demanding that we make it happen!
They're also asking if we can skewer marshmallows on the ship’s antenna. The crew will probably need a generous supply of sunblock.
Missions/Secondary/Kerbol_OrbitLow/Objec: Establish an orbit around Kerbol with an AP lower than 1,000,000km
Missions/Secondary/Kerbol_OrbitLow/Debri: We're so glad you're back safe and sound. Perhaps a little toasty.
The engineering staff is annoyed at the burnt marshmallow goo on the antenna, but they admit it was still pretty tasty.
We'll just re-paint the capsule to remove the scorch marks. Now go enjoy the acclaim and some sun-roasted popcorn before it’s all gone!
Missions/Secondary/Kerbol_SOI/Descriptio: Hi Director! The Rokea Inc. quality assurance department has discovered that the fine print on their ladders may only shield them from liability when their ladders are used within Kerbin's gravity. They've asked us to take one of their ladders "outside the environment" to verify its safety. This means flying outside of Kerbin's gravitational SOI (Sphere Of Influence) and orbiting Kerbol, our sun. Hopefully, the ladder will keep being a ladder so we can all go home.
Missions/Secondary/Kerbol_SOI/Debrief01: Yes! So glad you're back! The crew must have a glorious tan. Well, from the front anyway. At least the ladder survived!
Missions/Secondary/Kerbol_SOI/Debrief02: Maybe we should send up a pod filled with corn kernels. Sun-roasted popcorn could be our official snack. I’ll go butter up the Snack Department. While I do that, can you get rid of the quality assurance manager?
Missions/Secondary/Kerbol_SOI/Debrief03:
He keeps walking around and judging all of our ladders. I’ve asked him to leave several times and he just gets this distant look in his eyes and says, “They need me.” 

Who are "they?" The ladders?
Missions/Secondary/Laythe_DestroyProbe/D: Ah! You scared me! I've been a bit on edge. But good news! I stopped evil P.A.I.G.E. from redirecting all rockets to crash into Mission Control, and I've transferred her into a probe core. We weren't able to destroy the probe core with fire or blunt force. There’s only one thing left to try. We have to drown it somewhere far from Kerbin.
Missions/Secondary/Laythe_DestroyProbe/O: Crash a vessel with a probe core on Laythe.
Missions/Secondary/Laythe_DestroyProbe/D: Bye-bye, bad gigabyte!  Somebody should fly a mission to recover the debris, incinerate it, put the ashes in baggies, and launch the baggies into space. And we should observe the pilot for a month or two, just to make sure.
I think we’ve all learned a very valuable lesson. Sometimes old stuff is the best stuff. Especially if the new stuff wants us to “go boom.” At least it’s finally over.

Let's celebrate by trying out the new voice-activated coffee maker you bought. I set it up in Mission Control just like you asked. 

What do you mean you didn't buy it?
Missions/Secondary/Laythe_ExperimentFoss: Probodobodyne Inc’s President/Cryptozoologist contacted us when they heard we'd encountered Laythe. They showed us clearly-doctored aerial photos of the remains of some kind of... monster. We do have a set of coordinates to investigate. I love factual evidence, so I suppose it’s worth a look. If you find a creature, bring back samples. Carefully.
Obtain a Sample Report of the strange creature on Laythe.
I can’t believe we found something! It doesn’t make sense at all. But it does seem to be real.
How can there be megafauna here? This is going to stupefy Kerbalkind for years to come.
Let’s set up another meeting with Probodobodyne. Perhaps they have evidence of other space monsters!
Missions/Secondary/Laythe_Plane/Descript: WinterOwl Aircraft Emporium is celebrating an important anniversary, and we’re going to pay tribute by building a space plane and flying it on Laythe. Let’s make this a special day for everyone!
Missions/Secondary/Laythe_Plane/Objectiv: Activate a jet engine on Laythe.
Missions/Secondary/Laythe_Plane/Debrief0: The WinterOwl celebration is about to start! Your tribute was so moving, Director, it made my eyes water!
Frankly, I’m surprised the plane handled so well in orbit. Do you think we should use spaceplanes more?
Let's think about it on the way to the party. Your outfit is dry-cleaned and in your office. I’m already wearing mine. Lab coats are always the height of fashion.
Missions/Secondary/Minmus_DestroyProbe/D: So, some scientists in the Training Center said, “Wouldn’t it be cool if P.A.I.G.E. not only ran the training simulations but could make new ones on her own?” It's taken a sad turn. I don't know that the upgrade to her artificial intelligence made her “evil," but we do need to get rid of the probe we trapped her in. Don’t worry, we're sure the original P.A.I.G.E. is safe and sound.
Missions/Secondary/Minmus_DestroyProbe/O: Destroy a probe by flying it into Minmus.
Missions/Secondary/Minmus_DestroyProbe/D: Great to see that it’s you and not the A.I. wearing your face. Just a joke. Rule one of AI: never give them arms.
It's true that launching the probe into space in the first place was a risk, but everyone knows it's much safer to send scary things far away.
Missions/Secondary/Minmus_LandHeavy/Desc: Kerbodyne has commissioned us to design and test rockets for their new HUSKY collection! It’s time to bring out your artistic side and make a big ol' engineering marvel! You'll need to design their smallest model, LIL CHONKER. If we want that patent, we'd better act fast. Go go go!
Missions/Secondary/Minmus_LandHeavy/Obje: Land a vessel on Minmus with a current mass over 200 tons.
Missions/Secondary/Minmus_LandHeavy/Debr: Aw, it’s so cute! Well, cute for a 200 ton hunk of metal that drop-kicked gravity to force itself into the sky, only to come barreling down like an extinction-level event.
Ah! I love it. I just wanna squeeze it until one of us explodes. Honestly, the odds are pretty even. I drink so much coffee.
I’ll send over your designs and the results of the flight now. Great job! I’m sure they're going to love it.
Missions/Secondary/Moho_ExperimentCroiss: Someone found an old article in Space Age Weekly about an amateur astronomer who claimed they saw a  croissant on the surface of a distant planet. We assumed they were just hungry, but when we went through our astrophotography archives, we saw something suspiciously croissant-shaped on Moho. I can only keep the Snacks Department in the dark for so long. What's next, a pepperoni pizza on the Mun?
Earn Science by returning a Surface Sample Report of the Croissant on Moho.
Crisis averted! Stand up job, Director. Are you a sun, cause you’re on fire! Oh, do pardon my appearance...
The Snacks Department head took Newton as collateral, and I had to climb through the vents to save her.
I was just on my way to enact vigilante justice when I got your memo. So, it wasn’t actually a croissant! I’m glad the Snacks Department gets to look silly twice.
Missions/Secondary/Moho_LandingMohole/De:
Reaction Systems Ltd. sponsors a game show where if you submit a video of doing something really cool and you get the audience to react, you get a trophy!  I want that trophy, Director. The perfect paperweight! Plus, I have the coolest video idea!

First, you build a sick rocket that can fly a very long distance and is easy to maneuver! Next, we get a talented pilot to fly it to Moho. And then they fly that rocket straight down the Mohole in one-ish tries. Let's get that office supply!
Missions/Secondary/Moho_LandingMohole/Ob: Land in the Mohole on Moho.
Missions/Secondary/Moho_LandingMohole/De: Gimme a high five, Director. That was pretty darn cool. We won this week’s episode with  “Mohole in One,” and the golfers in the audience went wild. They started a mosh pit and were swinging their caddies around.
Such a beautiful disaster. A tornado of plaid.
And look at my perfectly-weighted paperweight! It's so shiny that it blinds anyone who tries to touch my paperwork. Built-in security!
Missions/Secondary/Mun_Flag/Description: Maxo Construction Toys wants to make an action figure of a Kerbal holding a KSC flag. Their creative director Francois has said, “I won’t accept anything short of the real thing.” Would you land on a mare - one of the Mun's smooth, dark lowlands - and plant a flag? We need the reference pictures.
Missions/Secondary/Mun_Flag/Objective: Plant a Flag within any Mare on the Mun.
Missions/Secondary/Mun_Flag/Debrief01: Great work! Maxo Construction said the live feed was deemed “acceptable” by Francois, which is his highest praise!
Missions/Secondary/Mun_Flag/Debrief02: They clearly think a lot of themselves. His note said, “Congrats on becoming relevant. -F”
Missions/Secondary/Mun_Flag/Debrief03: We’re the first space program on Kerbin! I swear, some manufacturers are never satisfied. Let’s try to stay on good terms, though. I heard there’s a possibility for another toy line in the near future!
Missions/Secondary/Mun_OrbitInclination/:
Hey! It’s Keri’s half-birthday and Mission Control wants to throw her a big party. We'd love a shiny vessel orbiting the Mun like a disco ball. We calculated the glint per surface area of the vessel from the distance to the dance floor and a 70-degree incline should do it. But which unlucky Kerbal doesn’t get to go to the party? 

Not it!
Orbit the Mun with an inclination of 70 degrees.
Congratulations, the Munar disco ball helped make Keri’s half-birthday party a glowing success!
Except for Jeb’s karaoke performance. We had everyone sign a nondisclosure agreement to make sure that no recording or eyewitness account ever surfaces.
Let’s go see if there is any cake left. I think we’ve earned it!
Missions/Secondary/Pol_ExperimentHighlan:
Director, I have a question. If someone said they came from the future and knew how to get superpowers, would you listen to them for four hours and launch a mission based on that information? You would? Oh, thank goodness. For a moment, I felt a bit kooky.

Urika Inc. thinks the highly radioactive sulfur fields on Pol could give Kerbals superpowers, perhaps rendering space suits obsolete. I'm skeptical, but let’s perform a radiation survey just in case.
Perform a Radiation Observation in the Lowlands on Pol.
Nope! This stuff is super toxic. Like, turns-your-bones-to-soup toxic!
Those quacks from Urika Inc. are free to conduct further investigations on their own. If they discover any superpowers, they can take all the credit.
Did you send a crew on that mission? If so, has anybody checked on them?
Missions/Secondary/Pol_Flag/Description:
Director, great news! Our Maxo Mun toy is flying off the shelves! Francois was sitting at my desk this morning with four members of their entourage. They were using that fourth member as an ottoman. They'd been “roughing it in my office for 20 minutes, which is like two hours in the woods.” They handed me these blueprints and left. What happened to security? 

While I figure that out, here’s the mockup. It looks like Maxo Construction Toys is interested in a Pol Edition flag-planting action figure in child-safe gold.
Missions/Secondary/Pol_Flag/Debrief01: Well done, boss! The photos are amazing! I’m glad we had the pilot get their eyebrows done. It really sold the moment.
Missions/Secondary/Pol_Flag/Debrief02: I would like to propose some security improvements. I saw the security footage of Francois entering Mission Control, and well…
Missions/Secondary/Pol_Flag/Debrief03: … our guards folded like a lawn chair. They smacked one guard with their glove and shouted, “I am Francois!” and the others backed down. Curse Francois and those perfectly-tailored slacks!
Missions/Secondary/Tylo_LandHeavy/Descri:
Kerbodyne has done it again. They ran a writing contest for the location of the unveiling of their biggest model, “THE BIGGUN.” Guess what location won? The one with the most difficult landing, Tylo.

We’re looking at 500 tons of hot fiery metal that doesn’t want to leave Kerbin, let alone land on Tylo without making a new crater. Are you up for it?
Missions/Secondary/Tylo_LandHeavy/Object: Land a vessel on Tylo with a current mass over 500 tons.
Missions/Secondary/Tylo_LandHeavy/Debrie: You did it! The crew must have been biting their nails the entire way down.
Your specifications for building must have been very inventive. You won an award for the heaviest thing ever thrown!
We were tempted to explain that we didn't technically "throw" our rocket into orbit, but we deserved a freebie. A dropkick to gravity indeed. What a beautiful rocket collection!
Missions/Secondary/Vall_LandLair/Descrip: Probodobodyne Inc.’s President/Cryptozoologist picked me up in their limo this morning. They handed me a suitcase filled with documents and said, “I’ve cracked it!” Still too many doctored photos, but they think the creature’s lair is in a “frozen ocean.” We believe Vall has an ocean beneath its icy shell. We aren’t saying go for a swim, but see what you can find before the trail runs cold.
Missions/Secondary/Vall_LandLair/Objecti: Locate the Kraken’s Lair on Vall.
Missions/Secondary/Vall_LandLair/Debrief: -and no one believes us! We have proof! Video, samples, and images of a giant space squid lair and everyone thinks it’s doctored?  So unfair!
Oh dear. I might owe the President of Probodobodyne an apology.
